summary: A letter from the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) Brooklyn to Judge Alison J. Nathan responding to a January 15, 2021 court order regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's confinement conditions. The MDC disputes defense counsel's claims about limited discovery access, detailing the extensive hours Maxwell has with a government laptop and discovery computers, and requests the order be vacated.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The inmate at MDC Brooklyn whose access to discovery materials and legal counsel is the subject of the letter. The MDC argues she has sufficient access.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who issued the January 15, 2021 order concerning Maxwell's confinement conditions. The letter is addressed to her requesting she vacate that order.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's criminal case (20 Cr. 330) and issued an order regarding her confinement conditions, which the MDC is asking her to vacate.

events.title: Court Order Regarding Maxwell's Confinement
events.description: Judge Nathan issued an order concerning Ghislaine Maxwell's confinement conditions at MDC Brooklyn, presumably in response to defense counsel's claims about limited discovery access.

events.title: Government Provides Laptop to Maxwell
events.description: The Government provided MDC Brooklyn with a laptop for Ghislaine Maxwell to use to review discovery materials for her case.

locations: Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, New York 11232
United States District Court, Southern District of New York, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The MDC Brooklyn claims Ghislaine Maxwell has access to a government-provided laptop for discovery review for 13 hours per day, 5 days a week.
Maxwell also has access to MDC discovery computers, which the institution states can review most of her electronic discovery.
Maxwell is allowed to communicate with her legal counsel 5 days a week, 3 hours per day via video-teleconference and phone, which the MDC states is far more than any other inmate.
The MDC requests Judge Nathan vacate her January 15, 2021 order and allow a return to the prior laptop access schedule (Monday-Friday, 7:00 AM to 8:00 PM).

The letter indicates the MDC had previously objected to the defense counsel's claims through the U.S. Attorney's Office but was not given a chance to object directly to the court before the order was issued.
